newsitem.title: RUSSIA: LUKoil preferred shares lead Russian stocks higher.
newsitem.headline: LUKoil preferred shares lead Russian stocks higher.

text.p: Leading Russian shares rose on Wednesday with LUKoil preferred shares leading the market higher after the company said it was planning an ADR issue for its preferred stock, traders said.
The Russian Trading System index of 24 shares rose by 2.09 percent to 187.56 on a large $33.84 million in volume.
"Today is a very strong market," said Martin Diggle from Brunswick. "We're seeing a lot of institutional buying interest. The biggest news on the market today was in LUKoil preferred shares."
LUKoil preferred shares were the gainer of the day with prices rising to $8.40 from $6.80 at Tuesday's close.
LUKoil said on Tuesday it had started proceedings with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to issue level-one American Depository Receipts on preferred stock.
The LUKoil news triggered a strong interest in all preferred shares, Diggle said.

UES preferred shares rose to $0.0512 from $0.0468, Norilsk Nickel preferred were $3.46 after $3.22, Rostelekom preferred rose to $1.92 from $1.69 and Surgutneftegaz preferred were $0.275 after $0.255.
Gazprom was again one of the most actively traded shares, after Mondays's pricing of its American Depositary Share issue, rising to $0.517 from $5.050.
Diggle forecast a further price rise in the next few days.
"The tone of the market is good," he said.
Surgutneftegaz ordinaries also rose strongly due to a big buy order for the paper with no sell orders, said Samit Yakovlev, chief trader at United City Bank.
"There are no sales in Surgutneftegaz traditionally," he said. "Clients either do not sell Surgut, or buy it."
The State Duma lower house of parliament released on Wednesday a list of 73 companies with large tax arrears. The list included UES, Yuganksneftegaz, Varyoganneftegaz, Irkutskenergo and AvtoVAZ.
But Diggle said the market shrugged off the news.
"I do not think people are really focusing on that. People know there are tax arreas. I do not think it is new news," he said.

Red October was traded at $16.50 after $14.35 at Monday's close, when the paper was last traded, Irkutskenergo fell to $0.105 from $0.1075 at Tuesday's close, Yugansknetftegaz was $8.30 after $8.35 and GUM rose to $24.00 from $22.00.
